comment: This class is independent, and fully administered through ALEKS. Video lectures, followed by homework for each chapter section. Class structure is concise and easy to follow. If you're comfortable independently learning STATS without a ton of oversight, this class is definitely for you. Weekly announcements are extremely consistent. Good class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I found this class to be enjoyable, the professor was relatively good at communicating but the work is very much independent with it being online. It is test heavy however you are allowed notes in your tests and as long as you do the homework you should be fine. Also use the free tutoring if it is a subject you find difficult.

If you are someone who hates taking math online very well I would not recommend it. This class consists of video learning and homework practice. Her tests were lockdown browser with camera so keep that in mind. A good thing about her is that she allows you to have a page of notes you can use on the test.

I know Dr. Ferguson wants her students to succeed, but if you can not teach yourself, then don't take this course. It is 100% taught through ALEKS. She sends weekly reminders and informs you of what's upcoming.  There are only 4 tests and a final (final replaces lowest test grade).

ALEKS is the bane of my existence. This class was difficult, but I'm also not great at math. The tests & quizzes are IMPORTANT and if you fail the final kiss your grade goodbye. I made a high A on the final but I prayed for an hour before the final and studied for over 15 hours. Prof is a bit petty and if you upset her she won't respond to emails.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: For me, I like classes that are direct with flexible schedules! I would say that this class only focus on ALEKS. Which is videos, homeworks, and 4 tests. And don't worry if you're struggling, you can retake the homework multiple times until you get a 100%. One problem is that THERE'S TOO MANY HOMEWORK. This class is very time consuming but chill.

If you are looking for great lectures and feedback, this class is not for you. If you want something self-guided this is an excellent option. Class is completely on ALEKS so you will be learning from videos and the book. You will only hear from Dr. Ferguson when she sends reminders. Very test heavy class so be prepared.

Great class & Dr. Ferguson has great communication, sends weekly updates & prompt responses. This online class used Aleks, no book. grades consisted of watching videos, homework & 3 tests + final. Profesor gives plenty of opportunity to pass. As long as you do the homework & the practice tests you will ace everything. Final replaced lowest test.

The tests are very important, but she provides you test preparation and even gives extra credit for the final. I missed the first test and thought I was going to fail but the final was able to replace it which also had extra credit so I ended up with an A. She was very nice when talking to her through email and other students said the same.
Easy if you have the time. But annoying is correct.

She does lots of projects and the only test are midterm and final. Her class is easy if you view the course material. It basically shows you how to do each project step by step. It is a lot of material but its basics! Work for you grade but she is an easy grader!
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Annoying.

Very easy class, but VERY annoying and tedious. The amount of busy work is mind-numbing, but if you can get through it, you WILL make an A. If you're into stats then the projects are really interesting. Super sweet lady too and can explain stats in a way that EVERYONE understands.

I think I spent more time working on busy work for this class than I did studying for my genetics and orgo class. Ferguson is a really nice lady but man this class was annoying. Quizzes are easy and some of the answers are online. Just follow her videos step by step for her projects and you'll do well, and finish the projects early. Easy class tho

Dr. Ferguson means well, she really does. If you can get past being talked to like a preschooler, you'll be A-okay. 5 mini projects, 10/12 quizzes count, and a final exam if you take the hybrid class. She's not good at giving rubrics beforehand, so follow the videos (if you can find them-she's very disorganized) and you'll be okay. Good luck!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Class is based off of 5 projects, about 10 quizzes and the final. Took the hybrid class so videos were posted online. Lecture was mandatory for attendance/participation points. Truly an easy A if you do great on the projects and quizzes.

Only test is a final. 5 projects, start with an individual portion then merge with a partner. Reverse class: you read notes on D2L and watch her youtube videos then do the projects. She may lecture a bit but it's not much, mostly just a quick review of material from notes. Follow the youtube videos to a t and you'll pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tests? Not many--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Don't let yourself fall behind and you'll be fine. Watch the weekly videos on time!! She actually tells you exactly how to do each mini project (which there are 5) and gives you excel tutorial videos. Put in the time and you'll make a good grade

This class is hard work but if you take it seriously you can do well. She's very helpful, wants her students to do well. We had 5 mini projects, 12 quizzes, midterm & final. I took the hybrid class. GO TO CLASS!! Textbook isn't really needed but helps for clarity. Class time is not for teaching. It's for clarification. Great teacher!
Vague and confusing instruction. This class made me hate the entire semester. Take someone else if you can. If not, it's not impossible. Know excel well beforehand.

A nice teacher but would not recommend. She is very vague in lecture and instructions for assignments. She is also a tough grader so when you miss something on your assignment because she was too vague you loose like 20points. She doesn't give the best feedback either, and when she does she's vague about that too. Class is definitely NOT worth it.

She was very enthusiastic, but did not make it clear what needed to be done on assignments - or would wait to clarify until just before they were due. The lectures for the hybrid course were all videos of her talking over powerpoints and excel, which were not easy to comprehend. The group assignments were rushed, so instructions would change midway

She's very friendly, but her lectures are incredibly difficult and vague. She jumps right into assignments, doesn't grade them for weeks and then doesn't give feedback. She gave us the midterm before she finished covering half of the material and no one even finished it in time. It's so difficult in a way that isn't even worth it.

Honestly, this was the hardest class iv'e ever encountered. She did give a lot of extra credit. She didn't respond to emails. She doesn't help really. She is nice though, but it's a very hard class. If able, I would try to take this class with someone else especially if your class load is already full. Oh! Make sure you complete the assign. EARLY!!

First half of the semester is very easy, but then it picks up.  Dr. Ferguson knows her stuff and it willing to help students with any problems as long as they ask.  Not an easy A, but if you put in the effort, you can get it.

Not an easy A, you have to earn it. What I liked about her was that she taught the class the way I learn material. I recorded lectures. Her online videos are very detailed and informative. 4 assignments, midterm/final and 10 quizzes. Very helpful teacher - make use of her office hrs. She is the reason I joined the STAT minor program!

This class is NOT an easy A. I hear most the teachers are MUCH easier than her. I took the hybrid class and had to teach myself everything. She doesnt teach anything and flies through anything done in class. She is SUPER vague about what she wants in the reports and then grades them SO STRICT. DON'T TAKE HER!

She is nice,but this class is not soo easy as it seems. I took the hybrid she expects assignments to be done so quickly but she takes so long to grade them. You have to teach yourself here, this grade depends on your input because she does absolute zilch, just has online videos
Dr Ferguson is a nice person, although her assignments are vague in expectations, she assumes you know alot already.Overall she is not bad but not exeptional either.

Dr. Ferguson is an amazing teacher. She knows Statistics very well. She is approachable and teaches with confidence.  Class grade consist of homework, quizzes, two test and attendance.  Tests were partial in class and take home.  She also gives a fair amount of extra credit. Overall, she is awesome. I highly recommend her!

Although I got an A in the class it wasn't without a lot of stress.  Ms. Ferguson assumes that everyone knows as much about Statistics as she does or that they took a Statistics class in High School.  She was disorganized and had problems with Web CT Vista.  She made the tests very tricky. The book and calculator (required) were hardly used.

Great teacher! She is always willing to help, very nice, and tries to make the class easy. The tests and quizes are a little hard because there are so many details to bother with. I highly reccomend her though!

Excellent teacher - I dreaded taking Statistics, but she has made it one of my favorite classes.  She goes at a pace you can keep up with, she explains everything really well, is very fair, gives practice tests so you are very prepared for the real test.  Impressive teacher!  very nice person as well.
Best and easiest math teacher I

Great professor!  Teaches class at a great speed willing to listen and offers help.  a lot of the material is online.  She also allows you to leave class early if you understand the material.  If you do the opitonal homework, show up to class, ask questions and do practice tests online you'll get an A.

Excellent teacher, Always finds time to help students after class or by e-mail. Gives great practice test. It you do the practice test , then you've pretty much got the test down. Sometime they are so exact that the only thing different is the numbers. I would definitly take her over any stats teacher at KSU. Has to be the best.

Great to take if you hate Math. She goes slowly, she is willing to go over things as many times as you need, and stays after class to answer any questions. Just make sure you go to class, otherwise you miss a lot.

omg i dont know whats up with all 1's from the last person...but this teacher is the nicest i've ever had...SO helpful and a great teacher. she takes things slow and personally if you dont get it...you probably shouldn't do anything with math. Do the work and you'll EASILY get an A. Went into final with a 100 average even. Definite great teacher
No Comments
